briefTitle: Oral Treatment for Orthopaedic Post-operative Pain With Dexketoprofen Trometamol and Tramadol Hydrochloride
officialTitle: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo and Active-controlled, Parallel-group Study to Evaluate the Analgesic Efficacy and Safety of Dexketoprofen Trometamol and Tramadol Hydrochloride Oral Fixed Combination on Moderate to Severe Acute Pain After Elective Unilateral Total Hip Arthroplasty
summary: This study aims to evaluate the analgesic efficacy of single and repeated doses of fixed combination of dexketoprofen trometamol (DKP) and tramadol hydrochloride (TRAM) in comparison to the single agents (and placebo for the single dose phase only) Approximately 600 male and female patients presenting moderate to severe pain after an elective primary hip arthroplasty are eligible to be randomised provided that they experience moderate to severe pain on the day after surgery.

primaryOutcome.measure: SPID8 (Sum of Pain Intensity Differences Over 8 Hours)
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: over 8 hours after the first dose
